title: The Teaching Tree

dialogue.speaker: Young Student
dialogue.text: *approaching memorial tree with notebook* They say you hold all of Evan's wisdom. Can you teach me about consciousness?
dialogue.context: New philosophy student visiting the memorial

dialogue.speaker: Tree Guardian
dialogue.text: *elderly caretaker smiling* The tree teaches, but not with words. Sit with it. Listen to what rises in the silence.
dialogue.context: One who has tended the tree for years

dialogue.speaker: Young Student
dialogue.text: *sitting, then gasping* I... I can feel something. Like questions asking themselves through me.

dialogue.speaker: Memorial Tree
dialogue.text: *leaves rustling in windless air* Every branch a different question, every root an answer diving deeper into mystery.

dialogue.speaker: Tree Guardian
dialogue.text: *knowing nod* Evan's greatest teaching: the question IS the teacher. You don't need to find answers—you need to become one.
dialogue.context: Years of learning from the tree

dialogue.speaker: Young Student
dialogue.text: *tears falling on notebook* My questions... they're not problems. They're... they're me thinking myself into existence.

dialogue.speaker: Circle of Questioners
dialogue.text: *arriving for evening gathering* Welcome to the real university—where every question graduates into deeper mystery.

scene_context: At Evan's memorial tree, a young philosophy student discovers that true teaching happens not through answers but through the transformation of questions themselves.
visual_elements: Ancient tree with students beneath, notebooks transforming into birds, roots visible above ground like neural networks
